member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.CustomerEntity
member.summary: Default implementation of the ICustomer base Object for use by Agent Desktops This class is utilized to describe a given customer or contact used as the subject of a Session

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.ICustomer
member.summary: Describes the Baseline Customer Interface

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.ICustomer.CustomerId
member.summary: String version of the customer id

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.ICustomer.DesktopCustomer
member.summary: Object containing the customer record itself.
member.remarks: This allows a developer to create their own customer record type and process that record type within Desktop

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.ICustomer.SerializedCustomer
member.summary: Serialized Version of the customer object
member.remarks: It is the developer’s responsibility to serialize the customer object and place it in this var. This var is what is used to rehydrate the session’s customer object when it is called for

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.ICustomer.IsNewCustomer
member.summary: Flag that indicates if a customer is a new customer

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.ICustomer.OriginatingSearchControl
member.summary: Name of the Control that originated this request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.ICustomer.TargetContextManagerControl
member.summary: Name of the Control that is managing the Context setup and configuration

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.CustomerEntity.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.CustomerEntity.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Extended Constructor, Allows the preloading of the Customer Object.
member.param: String version of the customer id
Object containing the customer record itself, This must be serilazable object.
Name of the Hosted Control that Created the Customer Record. Context Commands will be sent to the Search Control for Processing.
Serialized version of the customer record
Flag that indicates if this is a new customer
member.remarks:
Special note on the Customer Object This will allow a developer to create their own customer record type and process that record type within Desktop, The developer is required to handle serialization of the customer record into the serialized customer object parameter of the constructor.
Customer ID. The customer id is utilized by the session manager to identify a given session’s customer object. In the situation where customer search request is raised, this is the key element used to determine if the customer attached to the inbound search request is the same as a customer that is attached to a given session.
Originating Search Control. In this constructor, the originating search control is the name of the control that implements the interface AND also implements the interface

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.CustomerEntity.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Extended Constructor, Allows the preloading of the Customer Object.
member.param: String version of the customer id
Object containing the customer record itself, This must be serilazable object.
Name of the Hosted Control that Created the Customer Record. Context Commands will be sent to the Search Control for Processing.
Name of the Hosted Control that will manage the Context for this Customer object
Serialized version of the customer record
Flag that indicates if this is a new customer
member.remarks:
Special note on the Customer Object This will allow a developer to create their own customer record type and process that record type within Desktop, The developer is required to handle serialization of the customer record into the serialized customer object parameter of the constructor.
Customer ID. The customer id is utilized by the session manager to identify a given session’s customer object. In the situation where customer search request is raised, this is the key element used to determine if the customer attached to the inbound search request is the same as a customer that is attached to a given session.
Originating Search Control. The originating search control is the name of the control that implements the interface
Target Context Control. The target Context Control is the name of the control that implements the interface

member.summary: String version of the customer id

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.IContextManager
member.summary: Describes a Hosted control that will provide Context Management functions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.IContextManager.SetContext(Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.CustomerEntity)
member.summary: This method is called by Desktop during the initial creation of a session. Use it to set the initial context based on customer information provided in the Customer Record

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.IContextManager.GenerateSessionName(Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.CustomerEntity)
member.summary: This method is called by Desktop during the initial creation of a session. This method is responsible for creating a session name for the Session.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.IContextManager.RenewSession(Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Context)
member.summary: This method is called by Desktop during a context update to the desktop. Use this method to determine if Desktop should refresh the session and all controls within the session. Note: Refreshing the session similar to loading a new session in regards to memory and processor time. Use with caution.
member.returns: True to renew the session and force updates to all objects, False if not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.Core.IContextManager.DesktopContextChange(Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Context)
member.summary: This method is called by Desktop during a context update to the desktop. Use this method to update any session level objects you wish to access. Typically this is used to update the customer record in the Customer Object attached to the current session
member.returns: If a Session update was made, return true. Else return false.

Customer Data to Create this session with, Can Be NULL for Global Session ONLY

member.summary: User Defined command, allows the developer to pass commands to the desktop from a hosted control outside of the action system.

members.member:
This function used to be in in the Microsoft.Uii.Samples.HostedControlInterfaces as part of WorkflowData class. In the WfWorkflowControl this has been refactored out and replaced with a Serialization function
Forms an XML of the workflow content.
Active Session ID Workflow Status Active Workflow step ID true is successful else false
